title: Abandoned pups need loving homes
text:
Abandoned pups need loving homes The four rescued puppies that are waiting to be rehomed 
FOUR PUPPIES were dumped last week near the Selayang wet market. 
Luckily they were spotted by a kind stall operator, who informed a volunteer from canine welfare project Malaysian Dogs Deserve Better (MDDB). 
The puppies have since been rescued and are waiting to be rehomed. 
“Luckily, they were rescued before they became roadkill,” said MDDB adoption coordinator Christine Lai. 
The same volunteer in Selayang also rescued a young dog outside a factory near the wet market on the same day. 
The dog, which was eventually named Spiderman, was seen desperately running behind people and trying to get into cars when he was rescued. 
“He must have been brought there in a car and dumped, so he was trying to go home,” said Lai. 
Spiderman has since been vaccinated and neutered. 
The puppies and Spiderman will be up for adoption at the MDDB adoption drive at Gamuda Walk, Kota Kemuning tomorrow. 
The adoption drive from 11am to 6pm will be held next to Nandos and behind the Samsung outlets. 
“We hope to get them adopted as MDDB does not have space to keep them,” said Lai. 
She also criticised the irresponsible people who dumped the puppies and Spiderman on the streets, saying there would not been unwanted puppies if they had only neutered their pet. 
Those who wish to donate to MDDB in cash and kind can drop off their contributions at the adoption drive. 
For details, call 012-241 4749.
